initial_results:
### Text snippet from document at k=1
: Saul Metzstein (born 30 December 1970) is a Scottish film director. He is the son of renowned modernist architect Isi Metzstein, and Danielle Kahn. Metzstein was raised in Glasgow. He came to prominence with the 2001 feature "Late Night Shopping" (2001).

### Text snippet from document at k=2
: Douglas Eric "Doug" Liman (born July 24, 1965) is an American film director and producer best known for "Swingers" (1996), "Go" (1999), "The Bourne Identity" (2002), "Mr. & Mrs. Smith" (2005), "Jumper" (2008), "Fair Game" (2010), and "Edge of Tomorrow" (2014).

### Text snippet from document at k=10
: Saul Elkins (June 29, 1907 in New York, New York – May 9, 2001 in Henderson, Nevada) was an American writer, producer and director in the film industry.

Depth expansion, focusing on one of these topics, such as "American cinema," could lead to more specific terms like "New Hollywood directors," "independent film movement," which, while informative, need to be connected back to the original query's focus on birthdates.

Applying the technique systematically, I should first identify the most relevant and specific terms related to Doug Liman and Saul Metzstein's biographies, then expand into related but distinct areas such as their contributions to American cinema or their roles within the independent film movement.
